purpose.summary: Defines the Program Specification Block (PSB) named PAUTBUNL for a COBOL program. Specifies a single database PCB (PAUTBPCB) for accessing IMS database DBDNAME=DBPAUTP0 using PROCOPT=GOTP with KEYLEN=14. Declares two sensitive segments: PAUTSUM0 (root, PARENT=0) and PAUTDTL1 (child of PAUTSUM0).

inputs.name: PAUTSUM0
inputs.description: Root sensitive segment (PARENT=0) accessible via PAUTBPCB PCB in DBPAUTP0 database

inputs.name: PAUTDTL1
inputs.description: Child sensitive segment (PARENT=PAUTSUM0) accessible via PAUTBPCB PCB in DBPAUTP0 database

business_rules.description: Database access restricted to sensitive segments PAUTSUM0 and PAUTDTL1 under PCB PAUTBPCB
business_rules.logic_summary: SENSEG declarations define qualified access paths in hierarchical database

business_rules.description: Processing option set to GOTP (Get Unique Positioned) with 14-byte key length
business_rules.logic_summary: Enables sequential positioned read access only (no updates)

fields_used: UNKNOWN - segment layouts not defined in PSB
UNKNOWN - segment layouts not defined in PSB
UNKNOWN - segment layouts not defined in PSB

open_questions.question: What is the business purpose of the PAUTBUNL program and DBPAUTP0 database?
open_questions.context: PSB source defines only access structure, not business logic or data semantics
open_questions.suggestion: Analyze the COBOL program source that includes this PSB or review DBD/DBD source for DBPAUTP0

open_questions.question: What are the field layouts and key fields (KEYLEN=14) for segments PAUTSUM0 and PAUTDTL1?
open_questions.context: PSB does not include segment or field definitions
open_questions.suggestion: Examine DBD source for DBPAUTP0 and associated segment layouts

open_questions.question: Is this PSB used in batch, BMP, MPP, or IFP IMS region?
open_questions.context: No I/O PCB defined; only DB PCB with GOTP suggests non-transactional (batch/BMP) but cannot confirm
open_questions.suggestion: Check JCL or IMS region definitions referencing PSBNAME=PAUTBUNL
